about-me.p_1: Hi, you've come to the right place if you share my enthusiasm for beautiful designs and user-oriented processes.</br>I'm Christina Troitzsch, front-end developer.
about-me.p_2: I am particularly interested in how digital products feel when they are truly made for people.
about-me.p_3: Thanks to my many years of experience in the technical implementation of online advertising, I have developed a good understanding of precise requirements, tight timings and clean implementation. Reliability, open communication and a collaborative approach that leaves room for ideas form the basis for everything.

portfolio.description_polloloco: A jump-and-run game in which the player must collect various items to score points and defeat the final boss. It's all about chickens.
portfolio.description_kingscup: This is the digital version of the popular card game ‘King's Cup’. This app offers an interactive way to play the game online. Several groups can play independently of each other at the same time.
portfolio.description_join: A task manager based on the Kanban system that allows you to create tasks and organise them using drag and drop. You can register and manage your contacts.
portfolio.description_pokedex: Here, the content is fed via API, so that everything worth knowing about the little rascals can be accessed.

references.p_1: Here is some feedback from people I have worked with:

1.refText: Christina is a very interested front-end developer who always works with great care. Her passion for web development is evident, and she contributes significantly to the success of our projects.

2.refText: I have had the pleasure of working with Christina on several projects. She has an excellent eye for design and user-friendliness, which is reflected in the applications she has developed.

3.refText: I highly recommend her to any company looking for a talented and dedicated front-end developer.
